__Question 1__: _True or False_. Fix an environment $(T, B; (\succsim)_{t \in T}, (\succsim)_{b \in B})$ so the following holds:

There exists $t_* \in T$ and $b_* \in B$, with:

(1) $b_* \succ_{t_*} b$ for each $b \in B \setminus\{b_*\}$, and
(2) $t_* \succ_{b_*} t$ for each $t \in T \setminus \{t_*\}$.

Then, in any stable match $\mu: (T \cup B) \rightarrow (T \cup B), \mu(t_*) = b_*$

_____________________________________________________________________________

This is false. Let:

\[ \begin{cases}
			 t_1:  \\
			 \frac{1}{2} & x = 1 \\
			 \frac{1}{4} & x = 2 
		\end{cases}
\]
